intro: Ancistrocladus carallioides, commonly known as the African stinkwood, is a small evergreen tree or shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its dark, aromatic wood and compound leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers followed by red, fleshy fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
